Name: hexamethyldisilazane production, amination of chlorosilane | ammonium chloride | EN15804GD, U
Category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals
Description: Chlorosilane amination is the most important process to produce hexamethyldisilazane. Many chlorosilanes react with ammonia to give not stable, simple silylamines SiNH2, but disubstitution products with the SiNHSi building block. The exothermic reaction can be carried out in solvents such as hexane, toluene, or isododecane, but is best performed in warm HMDS itself. The latter variant leads to the formation of coarse-grained ammonium chloride, which can be readily stirred and filtered and gives better turnover and yield.
